Detailed Description

Basic shader class.

This shader class is used to load and store our shader information as well as initialize the shaders with OpenGL.

Version:
01
Date:
29/03/2018

Destructor.

The destructor calls destroy that will free up any used memory.

Member Function Documentation

std::string Shader::LoadShaderFile ( std::string  filePath  ) 

Loads the shader from file.

The function takes the file path given as a string parameter, opens up a file stream to read the file and stores the file as a string in a local variable that is then returned. It is used to read int and store the Vertex and Fragment shaders.

Parameters:
std::string filePath
Returns:
std::string

void Shader::Initialize ( std::string  vertFile,
std::string  fragFile 
)

Initializes the shader program.

This function takes the vertex and fragment shaders given as string parameters and creates both shdaders using glCreateShader(). The shader source is then set and assiged to their respected ids. The shader program is created and assigned to the m_shaderProgramId member variable and the two shaders are attached to this program. The program is then linked and it runs a check for any GL errors.

Returns:
void

GLint Shader::GetVariable ( std::string  variable  ) 

Gets the uniform variable.

Returns an ID with the same name as the string parameter in the shader.

Parameters:
std::string variable
Returns:
GLint

void Shader::SetInt ( GLint  id,
int  newValue 
) [inline]

Sets uniform value to int.

Calls glUniform1i() taking the id associated to the shader variable and changing it to the new value set by the second parameter given.

Parameters:
GLint id
int newValue
Returns:
void

void Shader::SetFloat ( GLint  id,
GLfloat  newValue 
) [inline]

Sets uniform value to float.

Calls glUniform1f() taking the id associated to the shader variable and changing it to the new value set by the second parameter given.

Parameters:
GLint id
GLfloat newValue
Returns:
void

GLfloat  v0,

) [inline]

Selects uniform value to be changed.

Calls glUniform2f() taking the id associated to the shader variable and changing the value according to the GLfloat parameters specified.

void Shader::SetMatrix4 ( GLint  id,
GLsizei  count,
GLboolean  transpose,
const GLfloat *  value 
) [inline]

Selects uniform value to be changed.

Calls glUniformMatrix4fv() taking the id associated to the shader variable and passing a 4x4 matrix of size 16 bytes (4 floats).

Parameters:
GLint id
GLsizei count
GLboolean transpose
const GLfloat* value

void Shader::TurnOn (  )  [inline]

Turns shader on.

Calls glUseProgram() turning the shader on.

Returns:
void

void Shader::TurnOff (  )  [inline]

Turns shader off.

Calls glUseProgram(0) turning the shader off.

Returns:
void

void Shader::Destroy (  ) 

Destroys any linked shaders.

Detatches and deletes the shader information. Sets the m_vertexShaderId, m_fragmentShaderId and m_shaderProgramId to 0.

Returns:
void
